channel.title: No one seems to be able to help me with this... plz help :(
channel.description: i right click on compile (when i download and extract a client) and edit to my version of java. i compile and it says finished (or whatever). then i double click on run.bat and a black box flashes up then nothing happens. :mad: :mad: :mad: :( :( :( plz help :(

item.title: No one seems to be able to help me with this... plz help :(
item.dc:creator: @whymeman whymeman
item.description:
@whymeman wrote:

Erm…
Well it depends. What java u have? I will use an example. Lets say i had java jdk 6.0…
Folow!!!
Start.
http://www.helpwithpcs.com/courses/windows-xp-tutorial/start-menu.gif

then click my computer
http://www.microsoft.com/library/media/1033/windowsxp/images/using/setup/maintain/67421-click-my-computer.gif

Then click ‘view system information’ in the top left panel

Then click on advanced
http://pure-essence.net/stuff/work/myComputerSpecs.png

on the bottom click ‘environment variables’
http://www.cs.usask.ca/~wew036/latex/env-env.jpg

then click ‘new’ on the top panel
http://www.7three.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/01/environment-variables-full.gif

Then type in ‘Path’ in the first entry box… Then type in ‘C:Windows\System32;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin’ for the second entry box… Obviously replace jdk1.6.0 with ur java. like jdk1.6.0_12\dhfdfhdfhj
now press ok.

do the same thing with the second panel…Click new and you do do the same thing…

Now time for classpath. Go to fist panel and click new… In first entry box type in ‘CLASSPATH’ then in the second box type in
C:Windows\System32;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\ …
press ok.
Now do the same thing to the bottom panel and you r good!!!
Make sure u replace wit wateva jdk u have like. jdk1.6.0

Read full topic

item.title: No one seems to be able to help me with this... plz help :(
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“the sizzler7, post:5, topic:276702”]when i right click run.bat and click edit i get this

@echo off title CLient java -Xmx500m -cp .;./bin; EGUI
there is no java directory thing. and im not trying to make a compiler, im just trying to play a client

is run.bat the right file to start client? [/quote]

You need to set your environmental variables.

Read full topic

item.title: No one seems to be able to help me with this... plz help :(
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

the sizzler7:

somehow that doesn’t seem to help me… HOW DO I HELP IT FIND MY JAVA DIRECTORY!!!

Find where your java is installed to. Right click and edit your run file to the proper directory.

Or try: http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,195700.0.html#post_compile
